Not sure of the steps to reproduce. Was deleting some files that were not yet 
under CVS control.

Steps to reproduce:
Rebuild the org.eclipse.ant.core plugin (which you have as shared) with the PDE 
Schema compiler option set to generate ref doc from schemas.
Get two new files not under CVS control (book.css and schema.css)
Delete these two files (select in Package Explorer, Delete key)

This is a known problem. The exceptions in this case can be ignored. We'll 
address this for the next intergration build.

I've released the code to handle the most common cases: There are still a 
couple of cases that may cause this exception (which has been turned into a 
slightly more informative log message):

1) Refresh Local: Not sure what we'll do here.
2) Removal of CVS/Tag

I've seen this occur in the folloiwng scenario involving checkout:

- operation A is log running and locks project A (or several projects)
- operation B is short running and locks project B
- operation B ends
- a delta is fired from operation A containing the changes from operation B
- These changes are treated as external changes resulting in log entries.

The above behavior is associated with the CVS/Template file. Perhaps we do not 
handle that file properly (i.e. mark it with the modification timestamp).

We no longer throw or log exceptions in the circumstances mentioned above. 
However, we are still generating unecessary events.

traces.message: The resource tree is  locked for modifications.
